messages.content: What are the operating modes available in the Searge-SDXL workflow?
The operating modes available in the Searge-SDXL workflow are Text to Image Mode, Image to Image Mode, and Inpainting Mode.
Can I create images from a text description in Searge-SDXL?
Yes, in the Text to Image Mode of Searge-SDXL, you can generate images from text descriptions alone.
What is the purpose of the mask in the Searge-SDXL workflow?
The mask in Searge-SDXL is used in Inpainting Mode to define the area of the source image where changes are applied.
How do I update an existing installation of SeargeSDXL?

To update an existing installation of SeargeSDXL, you should navigate to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ directory, run 'git pull' if you installed via git clone, or unpack the new SeargeSDXL folder and overwrite existing files if you installed from a zip file.
What are the recommended models to download for the Searge-SDXL workflow?

Recommended models for Searge-SDXL include SDXL 1.0 Base with 0.9 VAE, SDXL 1.0 Refiner with 0.9 VAE, ControlNetHED, res101, clip_vision_g, control-lora-canny-rank256, control-lora-depth-rank256, control-lora-recolor-rank256, and control-lora-sketch-rank256.
What is included in the 'alternative installation' method for SeargeSDXL?

The alternative installation method for SeargeSDXL involves downloading and unpacking the SeargeSDXL folder from the latest release on the CivitAI page to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory and restarting ComfyUI.
